metadata.title: CSCS Health & Safety Revision Questions
metadata.description: Comprehensive question bank for CSCS certification exam covering health and safety on UK building sites
metadata.author: Practice Content - Sourced from publicly available CSCS practice tests

questions.question: Which type of fire extinguisher is suitable for electrical fires?
questions.explanation: CO2 extinguishers are safe for electrical fires because CO2 is non-conductive and leaves no residue. Never use water on electrical fires.

questions.question: When should you replace your PPE?
answers: Only if your supervisor says so
When it is damaged or no longer fits properly
questions.explanation: PPE must be replaced when damaged, worn, or doesn't fit properly to ensure it provides adequate protection.

questions.question: What is the safe distance to work below live overhead power lines rated at 11 kV?
questions.explanation: For overhead power lines up to 11 kV, maintain a minimum safe distance of 3 metres to prevent electric shock.

questions.question: What does a blue mandatory safety sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Blue circular signs with white pictograms indicate mandatory actions that must be followed, such as wearing PPE.

questions.question: Which combination provides the highest level of hearing protection?
questions.explanation: Using both earplugs and earmuffs together provides the maximum hearing protection in very noisy environments.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of site inductions?
answers: To explain site-specific risks and rules
questions.explanation: Site inductions inform all workers about site-specific hazards, emergency procedures, and safety rules before starting work.

questions.question: What should you do if you find an unconscious person who is still breathing?
answers: Place them in the recovery position and call for help
Move them to a warmer area first
questions.explanation: If someone is unconscious but breathing, place them in the recovery position to keep their airway clear and call for emergency help immediately.

questions.question: What document must be in place before lifting operations with a crane?
questions.explanation: All lifting operations must have a lifting plan or method statement detailing safe procedures under LOLER regulations.

questions.question: Which substance causes the lung disease silicosis?
questions.explanation: Silicosis is a serious lung disease caused by breathing in respirable crystalline silica dust, commonly from cutting, grinding or drilling concrete, stone or brick.

questions.question: What should you do if you find a damaged ladder?
answers: Use it carefully if you need to
Tag it 'Do Not Use' and report it to your supervisor
Move up one rung to avoid the damage
questions.explanation: Damaged equipment must be taken out of service immediately, clearly marked, and reported to prevent anyone using it.

questions.question: How often should you visually inspect portable electrical tools before use?
answers: Only when the tool fails a test
Before every use by the operator
questions.explanation: Operators must visually inspect electrical tools before each use to check for damage to cables, plugs and the tool itself.

questions.question: Which type of hard hat provides the LEAST protection from side impacts?
questions.explanation: Bump caps only protect against minor bumps and have no side impact protection. They are not suitable for construction sites.

questions.question: What is the best way to control dust on a demolition site?
questions.explanation: Water suppression at the source of dust is the most effective control method, preventing dust from becoming airborne in the first place.

questions.question: Who is responsible for ensuring lifting gear is examined and certified?
questions.explanation: The duty-holder (usually the employer) is legally responsible for ensuring all lifting equipment is examined by a competent person and properly certified.

questions.question: Which part of the body does HAVS (Hand-Arm Vibration Syndrome) affect?
questions.explanation: HAVS damages blood vessels, nerves and joints in the fingers, hands and arms, caused by regular use of vibrating tools.

questions.question: What does red and white striped barrier tape indicate?
answers: A hazard that you must not cross
questions.explanation: Red and white striped tape marks a hazard or danger zone that must not be crossed without authorization.

questions.question: How should flammable liquids be stored on site?
answers: In any dry area away from rain
In a locked, ventilated, fire-resistant cabinet
Next to the generator for convenience
questions.explanation: Flammable liquids must be stored in secure, fire-resistant, ventilated cabinets away from ignition sources.

questions.question: Which regulations cover lifting operations and lifting equipment?
questions.explanation: LOLER (Lifting Operations and Lifting Equipment Regulations) 1998 covers the safe use of lifting equipment and operations.

questions.question: What is the FIRST step in the hierarchy of risk control measures?
questions.explanation: The hierarchy of control starts with elimination - removing the hazard entirely is always the most effective control measure.

questions.question: Why is it important to inspect welfare facilities under CDM 2015?
answers: To ensure toilets, washing and rest areas meet legal standards
questions.explanation: CDM 2015 requires welfare facilities to meet legal minimum standards for workers' health, hygiene and wellbeing.

questions.question: When does your employer need to provide a first-aid box?
answers: Every site should have one regardless of employee count
questions.explanation: All workplaces must have adequate first-aid provisions regardless of the number of employees.

questions.question: What is the purpose of protective mid-soles in safety footwear?
answers: To increase comfort throughout the day
To support ankles and prevent twisting
To protect feet from falling objects
To protect feet from stepping on sharp objects like nails
questions.explanation: Protective mid-soles prevent sharp objects like nails from penetrating through the sole of the boot.

questions.question: Why are site inductions important?
answers: Work site health and safety rules are discussed
It's an opportunity to meet colleagues formally
It allows you to look around the work site
It's a chance to meet the site manager and supervisors
questions.explanation: Site inductions are crucial for communicating site-specific hazards, emergency procedures, and safety rules before work begins.

questions.question: Class 3 ladders are suitable for what type of use?
questions.explanation: Class 3 ladders are designed for light domestic use only and should never be used on construction sites.

questions.question: When working in a hearing protection zone you must:
answers: Not use loud equipment or machinery
Ensure you wear appropriate hearing protection
Work as fast as possible and leave to reduce exposure
questions.explanation: Hearing protection zones require all workers to wear appropriate hearing protection due to high noise levels.

questions.question: What should you do if you notice a safety hazard?
answers: Report it to your supervisor immediately
Keep working and report it at the end of your shift
questions.explanation: Safety hazards must be reported to your supervisor immediately to prevent accidents and injuries.

questions.question: Why is signing in important when arriving on site?
answers: To ensure correct working hours are recorded
To ensure everyone can be accounted for during an evacuation
The HSE needs records of working hours
questions.explanation: Site sign-in systems are crucial for emergency roll calls and ensuring everyone is accounted for during evacuations.

questions.question: Which fire extinguishers are suitable for electrical fires? (Choose 2 answers)
questions.explanation: Both CO2 and dry powder extinguishers are safe for electrical fires as they are non-conductive. Never use water or foam on electrical fires.

questions.question: What could happen if you ignore warning signs regarding toxic substances?
questions.explanation: Ignoring warnings about toxic substances can lead to serious health problems including poisoning, organ damage, and chronic illness.

questions.question: When working with hazardous substances, what should employers check regularly?
questions.explanation: Employers must monitor workers' health through health surveillance when exposed to hazardous substances to detect early signs of harm.

questions.question: Which exposure is NOT likely to cause lung disease?
questions.explanation: While unpleasant, strong smells alone don't cause lung disease. Silica, asbestos, and organic matter from bird droppings can all cause serious lung conditions.

questions.question: Environmental protection at work involves:
answers: Reducing water and energy usage whenever possible
questions.explanation: Environmental protection includes conserving resources like water and energy, minimizing waste, and preventing pollution.

questions.question: How can fatigue affect a worker's output?
answers: It can decrease their work output due to tiredness
It has no effect on productivity
questions.explanation: Fatigue reduces concentration, reaction times, and work quality, increasing the risk of accidents and decreasing productivity.

questions.question: When a mobile crane is operating nearby, you should:
answers: Raise your hands to signal the operator
Assess the situation and slip across when safe
Find another route and stay away from the crane
questions.explanation: Always maintain a safe distance from operating cranes and find alternative routes to avoid the danger zone.

questions.question: If you notice a lorry with a flat tyre, you should tell the driver because:
answers: They will need to drive slower
The lorry could be unsafe to drive
They need to unload materials first
questions.explanation: A flat tyre makes a vehicle unstable and unsafe to drive, potentially causing loss of control and serious accidents.

questions.question: If diesel spills while refueling equipment, you should:
answers: Locate the spill kit and then report it
Do nothing as it will seep away naturally
Inform your supervisor immediately and then find the spill kit
Report it at the start of the next shift
questions.explanation: Fuel spills are environmental hazards and fire risks. Report immediately and use spill kits to contain and clean up the spillage.

questions.question: If safety induction information seems outdated, you should:
answers: Talk to your supervisor about the matter
Do nothing and continue as normal
questions.explanation: Outdated safety information can be dangerous. Report concerns to your supervisor so procedures can be reviewed and updated.

questions.question: What is the main danger of walking beside a 360° crane operating near a wall?
answers: The crane could hit the wall and debris could fall
The crane could crush you against the wall
questions.explanation: 360° cranes can swing unexpectedly and trap or crush people against walls or other solid objects. Always maintain safe clearance.

questions.question: Which voltage can cause severe injury or death through electric shock?
answers: All of the listed voltages can cause death
questions.explanation: Any voltage can be lethal. Even 110V can kill under the right conditions. Always treat all electrical systems as potentially dangerous.

questions.question: Which are recommended methods of hearing protection? (Choose 2 answers)
questions.explanation: Only purpose-designed ear defenders (earmuffs) and disposable earplugs provide effective hearing protection. Improvised materials are ineffective.

questions.question: If a load might fall from a vehicle, you should:
answers: Ignore it as it's the driver's responsibility
Stay away from the vehicle and warn the driver and others
Try to hold the load in place
questions.explanation: Unsafe loads are an immediate danger. Keep clear, warn others, and alert the driver immediately.

questions.question: Blue-banded fire extinguishers contain:
questions.explanation: Blue label indicates dry powder extinguishers, which are suitable for most fire types including electrical fires.

questions.question: What do risk assessments identify?
questions.explanation: Risk assessments identify workplace hazards and evaluate risks to determine necessary control measures.

questions.question: Before manually carrying a load, you should consider:
answers: The distance you need to travel
Whether the path is clear and free from hazards
The weight and dimensions of the load
questions.explanation: Manual handling assessments must consider the task, the load, the environment, and individual capability.

questions.question: Besides CO2, which other fire extinguisher is suitable for electrical fires?
questions.explanation: Dry powder extinguishers are non-conductive and safe for electrical fires along with CO2 extinguishers.

questions.question: What does the MIND charity do?
answers: Provides financial aid for construction workers
Provides mental health support and advice
questions.explanation: MIND is a mental health charity that provides support, advice, and resources for people dealing with mental health issues.

questions.question: What do green safety signs signify?
answers: An action that employees must take
questions.explanation: Green signs indicate safe conditions, emergency exits, escape routes, and first aid facilities.

questions.question: If there is a large fire on site and you have not been trained to use fire extinguishers, you should:
answers: Leave the site and go home
Go to your assembly point immediately
questions.explanation: In a large fire, evacuate immediately and go to the assembly point. Only fight small fires if trained and it's safe to do so.

questions.question: If you discover a better method for lifting loads, you should:
answers: Ask colleagues if they agree with your idea
Forget about it and continue as normal
Discuss your idea with your supervisor
Ignore the current method and use your own
questions.explanation: New methods must be discussed with supervisors and risk assessed before implementation to ensure they are safe.

questions.question: Clean work environments help prevent:
questions.explanation: Good housekeeping prevents multiple hazards including pest problems, slip and trip hazards, and environmental contamination.

questions.question: If you are feeling symptoms of work-related stress, you should:
answers: Eat more food during the day
Speak to someone independent or a close friend you trust
Tell all your colleagues about it
Leave work and go home immediately
questions.explanation: Talking to someone you trust or seeking independent advice is important for managing work-related stress and mental health.

questions.question: If a power tool is missing its guard, you should:
answers: Not use the tool until it has been fitted with a proper guard
Wear thick gloves and continue using it
Make your own guard from scrap material
Use it only for short bursts
questions.explanation: Guards are essential safety features. Never use power tools with missing or damaged guards - report and remove from service.

questions.question: Red-banded fire extinguishers contain:
questions.explanation: Red labels indicate water extinguishers, suitable for wood, paper, and fabric fires but never for electrical fires.

questions.question: What is a 'near miss'?
answers: A minor accident that doesn't need reporting
An accident that results in time off work
A minor accident that could have been prevented
An accident which was narrowly avoided
questions.explanation: A near miss is an unplanned event that could have resulted in injury or damage but didn't. Reporting near misses helps prevent future accidents.

questions.question: Before operating site plant or machinery, you must be: (Choose 2 answers)
questions.explanation: You must be both trained/competent and specifically authorized to operate plant and machinery on construction sites.

questions.question: What happens to the nozzle of a CO2 fire extinguisher when in use?
questions.explanation: CO2 extinguisher nozzles become extremely cold due to the rapid expansion of compressed gas. Never touch the horn directly.

questions.question: What health condition can result from regular use of vibrating tools?
questions.explanation: Regular exposure to vibration from power tools causes HAVS, damaging blood vessels, nerves, and joints in hands and arms.

questions.question: What health risk comes from wet cement contact with skin?
questions.explanation: Wet cement is highly alkaline and can cause severe chemical burns, skin irritation, and dermatitis. Always wear protective gloves.

questions.question: Which item does NOT need a PAT (Portable Appliance Test)?
questions.explanation: Battery-operated equipment doesn't need PAT testing as it doesn't connect to mains electricity. Only mains-powered appliances require PAT testing.

questions.question: What does PAT stand for?
questions.explanation: PAT stands for Portable Appliance Test, the safety testing of electrical appliances to prevent electric shock and fire.

questions.question: If a co-worker is feeling dizzy and faint, you should:
answers: Have them lie down in a comfortable position
Move them to a cooler environment immediately
questions.explanation: Help them lie down comfortably to prevent falling and injury. Monitor them closely and call for help if they don't recover quickly.

questions.question: Why is an RCD used with 230-volt electrical tools?
answers: It makes the tool more energy efficient
It lowers the voltage to a safer level
It makes the tool run faster
It quickly cuts off power if a fault is detected
questions.explanation: RCDs (Residual Current Devices) detect electrical faults and cut power within milliseconds, preventing fatal electric shocks.

questions.question: Why should you never walk behind a reversing lorry?
answers: The driver might not see you there
questions.explanation: Despite mirrors and cameras, drivers have blind spots. Never walk behind reversing vehicles - you could be crushed.

questions.question: If you need specific RPE (Respiratory Protective Equipment) but none is provided, you should:
answers: Use whatever RPE is available instead
Do not start work until you have the correct RPE
Work but take regular breaks for fresh air
Work quickly to finish as soon as possible
questions.explanation: Never start work without the specified RPE. Different hazards require specific protection - using wrong RPE provides no protection.

questions.question: What is the best method to minimize dust on site?
answers: Dampen the work area with water spray
Cover the entire work site with sheets
questions.explanation: Water suppression at source is the most effective dust control - preventing dust from becoming airborne in the first place.

questions.question: What is an advantage of battery-powered tools over electrical tools?
questions.explanation: Battery tools eliminate electric shock risks and trailing cables, making them safer especially in wet conditions or confined spaces.

questions.question: What do blue and white safety signs indicate?
questions.explanation: Blue circular signs with white symbols indicate mandatory actions that must be followed, such as wearing specific PPE.

questions.question: If you have a previous back injury that might affect your current work, you should:
answers: Explain the situation to your supervisor before starting the job
Continue working and only report it if you feel pain
Wear a back support brace and continue
Ignore the problem as it's in the past
questions.explanation: Inform your supervisor of pre-existing conditions before starting work so appropriate adjustments or alternative tasks can be arranged.

questions.question: Which of these is helpful for managing stress?
questions.explanation: Adequate rest and sleep are essential for managing stress, maintaining health, and staying alert and safe at work.

questions.question: How many points of contact should you maintain when using a ladder?
questions.explanation: Always maintain three points of contact (two hands and one foot, or two feet and one hand) when climbing ladders.

questions.question: Yellow underground service pipes carry:
questions.explanation: Yellow markings indicate telecommunication cables underground. Always check service plans before excavating.

questions.question: What are the three elements of the fire triangle? (Choose 3 answers)
questions.explanation: Fire requires three elements: heat (ignition source), fuel (combustible material), and oxygen. Remove any one to extinguish fire.

questions.question: What is the correct procedure when petrol spills during refueling?
questions.explanation: Stop refueling immediately, contain the spill to prevent spread, then notify supervisor. Petrol vapors are highly flammable.

questions.question: What increases the risk of lung cancer?
answers: Breathing in harmful dust over time
questions.explanation: Inhaling harmful dusts like asbestos, silica, and certain wood dusts significantly increases lung cancer risk over time.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a risk assessment?
answers: To show locations of safety equipment
To identify hazards and provide safe methods for carrying out tasks
To indicate who the site safety lead is
questions.explanation: Risk assessments identify hazards, evaluate risks, and establish safe working methods to prevent accidents and injuries.

questions.question: When working alone, you must:
answers: Maintain regular contact with your team
questions.explanation: Lone workers must maintain regular contact so someone knows they are safe and can raise alarm if contact is lost.
